entry.title: Blind Faith
entry.summary:
Author: AxisMage

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 48,781Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 68

Summary: It's no one's fault but his own that Dick is sitting there now, cold and utterly miserable, and very close to freezing to death.It's no one's fault but his own that he let his heart and mind get away again. It's no one's fault but his own that he wanted for someone who couldn't and wouldn't be his, and Wally is right.Dick needs to get back to his life, start over and make new friends. That's all, nothing more and nothing less. Friends, Dick needs friends, and sadly (according to Wally), Krypto isn't enough.

entry.title: You Are Out of My League
entry.summary:
Author: ivebeenbamboozled (brainwitchletty)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 254,014Chapters: 26/?Kudos: 841

Summary: The story begins with a new Robin to replace the old, with Nightwing none the wiser to being replaced at all, and suddenly he has a little brother within the same terrible day. It takes a while to accept, but Dick quickly learns this new Robin-- Jason Todd-- is exactly what Dick Grayson was always missing in his life, and in many more ways than one. Through the years with the team and working with the Justice League, Jason finds a place for himself and becomes a vital member of the Young Justice League while also becoming a vital centerpiece in Dick's life. And when all that ends-- when Jason Todd is taken away from Dick-- it's going to be even harder to put his life back together with that emptiness returning once more.. . .Mostly canon compliant story detailing Jason's introduction to the Young Justice League as Robin, his eventual death, and Dick discovering the mysterious red-hooded figure acting as Ra's Al Ghul's bodyguard is a lot more familiar than he should be.

entry.title: We Can't See the Skyline
entry.summary:
Author: Rawrbin

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,142Chapters: 13/25Kudos: 511

Summary: Jason Todd is a struggling college student, part-time mechanic, and full-time closeted homosexual, just trying to get by in Park Row. When he needs a roommate in order to pay the bills, fate delivers him Dick Grayson, a charming man with a mysterious past. Jason suspects they may have more in common than they can speak out loud. Will he be able to keep their roommate relationship platonic? And what is Dick Grayson's real history?

entry.title: a grave in the sky (where it's roomy to lie)
entry.summary:
Author: svalas

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,714Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 39

Summary: Nightwing stood up, and the expression on his face made Spoiler step back nervously. His hand unfurled, shaking, revealing a sharp and bloody switchblade. Its body was a beautiful red. A phoenix had been carved into the side. “Somebody was here.” If his voice went any tighter it might shatter. “And we were too late.” (Again, he added in his mind. Then he flinched and had to remind himself—not Jason. Jason’s dead. Just the Joker.) or, what might have happened if Black Mask was just a bit smarter

entry.title: False Front
entry.summary:
Author: SavioroftheStars

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 111,007Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 256

Summary: Dick Grayson is an undercover agent, tasked with infiltrating the Red Hoods, a dangerous new gang with a strict code of ethics. Posing as Ricky Kelly, a former sex worker with a fabricated past, Dick is sent to gain the trust of their leader, the mysterious and unpredictable Red Hood. As he works his way deeper into the gang, Dick quickly realizes that the Red Hoods are unlike any other criminal organization he’s encountered—disciplined, strategic, and governed by a unique moral code.But things become complicated when Dick finds himself developing feelings for their enigmatic leader and growing closer with the people he was sent to deceive.

entry.title: Rook
entry.summary:
Author: Winterlynne_Norvic

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,896Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 381

Summary: There were many things in life that Damian had failed at. Not necessarily were those things always his fault, but that did not excuse them from being his responsibility. So while he could not claim to have known better when he made the mistakes, as an adult now in possession of better decision making skills, he has decided to rectify the mistakes that could still be fixed.He even made a list. An itemised one, in order of severity and importance of correcting said mistakes. It is.... to say the least, not a short list. Nor an easy one to stare at, though Damian does not let that fact deter him. He had done a year of Redemption before, he knew it would not be easy, but that didn’t mean he would allow that to stop him from atoning and starting anew.If he could survive long enough to do so, that is.…Solo-patrols might have been a mistake, but you live and you learn, y’know?Usually, at least.
